intro: Parodia carambeiensis, commonly known as the Carambeí Cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in dry environments. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant.
